author: Pavan Dahat
text:
Three Maoist guerrillas, two of them women, belonging to the banned Communist Party of India (Maoist) were killed in two different encounters in restive Bastar region of Chhattisgarh on Saturday morning, the police said.

“Two encounters took place in Bastar today morning. Two women Maoists were killed and their bodies recovered after an encounter in Sukma district. The second encounter took place at Pannur village of Bijapur district leading to the death of a Maoist trainer in that area,” Bastar range Inspector General of Police, S.R.P. Kalluri said.
title: 3 Maoists killed in Bastar
